And I'm reporting for food and Drug Administration says it will ban the use of southern food additives that have been used in a variety of foods and beverages for decades and bigger as Allison Aubrey reports the move is in response to legal action brought by environmental groups
The additives can be used in a range of foods from ice cream to baked goods to gum they infused with cinnamon meant and other flavors you would not know if they're in the food you buy because food manufacturers are allowed to label them simply adds artificial or natural ingredients
And natural resources Defense Council and other groups petitioned the FDA to remove them pointing to cancer risks

Astronomers are learning more about Saturn's rings things to new data emerging from the Cassini mission which plummeted into the planet last year Texas Public Radio's Paul flab reports the rings are shutting twenty two thousand pounds of material per second according to a paper in the journal science
Last year the Cassini probe spent months and twenty two orbits diving between Saturn and its rings and what NASA called grand finale newly released findings from those orbits contradict decades of understanding scientists thought Saturn's rings we're shedding a tiny drip of water vapor and grand you walk into the planet
